properties.areaDesc: Gove; Greeley; Wichita; Cheyenne County; Wallace; Logan
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 18 at 1:25PM MST until February 20 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Goodland KS
properties.description:
...Light to moderate snowfall expected for the Tri-State area...

.An upper-level trough over the central United States will lead to
some light to moderate snow showers from Wednesday around the late
morning hours through Thursday morning. The heaviest snowfall
amounts on the order of 2 to 4 inches are expected south of
Interstate 70 with most of that falling overnight Wednesday.
Areas along and north of Interstate 70 could still see around 2
inches of snow with locally higher amounts possible. Wind gusts as
high as 20 to 30 mph could lead to some patchy blowing snow
Wednesday and Thursday.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches.
Blowing snow could reduce visibility at times.

* WHERE...Portions of west central Kansas and east central
Colorado.

* WHEN...From 11 AM MST /noon CST/ Wednesday to 5 AM MST /6 AM
CST/ Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous
conditions could impact the evening commute Wednesday and the
morning commute Thursday.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... Light snow could start as early as
Wednesday morning with the heaviest snowfall expected overnight
Wednesday night.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM MST /NOON CST/ WEDNESDAY TO 5 AM MST /6 AM CST/ THURSDAY
